alert.note: Alert for Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 4:50AM CDT until April 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Starr and Zapata. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roma, Escobares, La Rosita, Salineno, Falcon Heights, Falcon State Park, New Falcon, Falcon Dam, Roma High School, Roma Creek, Roma Public Library, Barrera Elementary School, Roma City Hall, Fronton, North Escobares, Roma City Police Department, Roma Park, Garceno and Rio Grande City--roma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
